name: saru
text:
I am an undergraduate, and I must state, for the record, that humans are a _species_.
Race is not scientifically defined, therefore conflating it with ethnicity is not particularly incorrect. In fact, it basically refers to any arbitrary grouping of people sharing a common descent. At the broadest scope this is, in fact, all of humanity, but it is equally correct to state that I am a member of the "Woods" race.

name: snowman
text: But,

name: glorify
text: eight months later, this is still one of my favorite comments on all of Assetbar.

name: mockereo
text: you're saying you're black like tiger woods after all that stuff about race not existing ohmahgawd hypocrite

name: sp1derbaby
text:
I only see one colour.

Purple - because my eyes are damaged.

name: thatcrazycommie
text: I once heard about this French guy named Napoleon who took over most of the world.

name: jeet
text: He is just an urban legend.

name: slalvation
text: He was actually Italian, sort of.

name: trollcollins
text: He was actually Corsican , which is sort of technically neither Italian nor French. But closer to French than Italian.

name: slalvation
text:
His family was Italian, and his first language was Italian, and after he learned French he spoke it with an Italian accent.

He was born the year after France gained ownership of Corsica. Regardless of what Corsica is closer to today, at the time, the people there were of Italian descent and spoke Italian and were definitely not French.

name: trollcollins
text:
Congratulations, Corsica! You are . . . the island of the week!

No seriously, knowledge is always good, so a little hat tip.

name: comrade_tom
text: Sure he was raised with the Italian language but Napoleon was pretty Damn french. Churchill was half american yet was voted greatest Briton. Eamon de Valera was american but he ran Ireland for practically forever.

name: boredom_man
text:
And Golda Meir was not born in Palestine.

(quickly dons asbestos suit, wanders off, whistling)

name: tekende
text: There is nothing immoral about gorillas who perform for the circus.

name: eric
text:
Philippe does not need to sit on a chair in this strip. He merely perches atop his massive balls.

On a related note, I am wildly in favor of telling children that they have got a pair.

name: closefriend
text: I'm not so much, but that's because I'm against any son of mine having a pair. It's just easier to get them neutered than walking in on them when they're 14.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Phillipe just sassed the pope out of America.  He just sassed him so hard.

name: davidbowie
text: oh fuck yeah!

name: epicurus
text: I love Beef's Pope face. It is so right.

name: baryonyx
text: Epicurus, looking over this strip's comments, this page is basically your fiefdom on Assetbar.

name: mystkmanat
text: We are your serfs.  Here, have 1/3 of my harvest.

name: aelindil
text: You are a serf.  You have no harvest except that which you BORROW from epicurus!

name: epicurus
text:
In my magnaminity, I allow you each to toil usefully in my fields, and I generously make a gift to each of you of 1/20th of the fruit of my fields that you are able to bring forth with my help!

Naturally it is my lot in life to control these ripe fields, because, in what was to be known as an epic internet maneuver, I managed to play the race card as a person of frenchish heritage. Let the heralds sing of my exploits.

Now get back to them fields. Those turnips aren't about to irrigate themselves!

name: scorpio_nadir
text: All scrunch-faced Beef. Starts with a benign cranky, then moves on to damnation of Philippe's mom. He needs some remedial people-skills from Vatican H.R.

name: trevor
text: Heh, yeah, Roast Beef has such a mean look when he is the pope.

text: new roast beef tshirt: front: "you are all hella lazy and a bunch of fatsoes to boot" (back): "Plus you got bad morals"

text: This has to be one of the very few times that anything Roast Beef says necessitates an exclamation point.  He really is impressed.

name: gumfish
text: A comment left by gumfish was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by equinn2006, apmihal, Dwilow)

name: connellingus
text: The "lamb" is probably referring to Jesus, the "lamb of God," so he's calling Philippe a child of Jesus.

name: heccibiggs
text:
I gotta agree with Gumfish here, it does seem like a pretty wacko mixed metaphor. I don't think he deserved those three lames. Especially when he used the word "lambfruit".

A chubby for you, Gumfish, blessed fruit of the lamb.

name: lawbot
text: Blessed be the fruit?

name: puguglypress
text: I think it was a crack about french food.

name: jezebel
text:
I thought RB was talking about underwear. Then I realized the word was "lamb" and not "loom".

Then I couldn't decide which way was funnier. So now I let them fraternize in my head, making the strip twice as funny.

name: varnish
text:
Phillipe really has a massive set on him. I mean, it is stone cold hard to take on the pope like that.

I applaud Phillipe in this strip. And I come from a very Catholic family.

text:
Philippe would be a bad choice for president

all you have to do is get into his confidence, tell him to shove it, and he's assassinated

text: Why is there no *^5 rating? >:-S  Philippe deserves so much more for that remark.  I'd be so proud if my son said that to the Pope!

name: catbark
text: This is why I love Philippe. Leave it to a five year old otter to show us how governments should do a thing.

name: sharpdresseddan
text: Definately one of the best strips ever. Beef's impression of the Pope is classic, and Phillipe is portrayed in a way that we've never seen before. An easy 5.

text: You gotta love philippe for lovin his mother like that! Stick it to the man!

text: You had better believe he "really got a set" Beef.

text: I wish the pope told momma jokes.

text: He does, they're just really judgmental.

name: riotdejaneiro
text:
"Here comes a special president".
Plus, think about Philippe meeting, for example, the president of Iran.
"Hello, Sir, I am happy to talk to you, but you can´t continue your nuclear program"
"No"
"Okay. It sure is nice talking to you (big smile)"

name: sncether
text:
Dear AOL Hometown user,

We're sorry to inform you that as of Oct. 31, 2008, AOL® Hometown was shut down permanently. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Sincerely,

The AOL Hometown Team

Now I will hear no more complaining about the burning of the Library at Alexandria, do you hear?

name: sevenslashfour
text: Man, I love Roast Beef.
